description: The head of the Israeli army told troops to prepare for a ground assault in Lebanon as Israel and Hezbollah launched airstrikes for a third day. More than 600 people have been killed in Lebanon, according to health officials there. NBC News' Richard Engel reports from Beirut.
title: Israeli army tells troops to prepare for ground assault in Lebanon

description: In an exclusive interview, NBC News' Kier Simmons spoke with President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey. Erdogan says the country is an ally of the U.S., but doesn't believe Hamas is a terrorist organization. turkey is an ally of the united states and yet doesn't believe Hamas is a terrorist organization.
title: Turkey's president Erdogan: 'I never called Hamas a terrorist organization'

description: Most Chinese Americans feel that the current relationship between the U.S. and China is a negative one, and almost two-thirds think that such contentious relations can affect how other Americans treat them, a new study shows.
title: 64% of Chinese Americans think tense U.S.-China relations affects how others treat them

description: After her stone-cold expression went viral at the Paris Olympics, sharpshooter Kim Ye-Ji will play the role of an actual assassin in an upcoming Korean series.
title: Viral Korean sharpshooter to star as assassin in upcoming series

description: A house was partially destroyed and set on fire after it was hit by a rocket in Safed, northern Israel. Nearby, a hillside was peppered with explosions as other rockets struck close to a highway.
title: Videos show house and hillside in northern Israel   hit by Hezbollah rockets

description: The death of an American woman in an assisted suicide capsule has led to criminal proceedings being launched against several people in Switzerland.
title: American woman's death in suicide capsule leads to arrests in Switzerland

description: Warning sirens sounded in Tel Aviv on Wednesday as a single surface-to-surface missile was intercepted by air defense systems after it was detected crossing from Lebanon, the Israeli military said.
title: Video shows missile streaks in the sky near Tel Aviv

description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer accidentally called for "return of the sausages" instead of Gaza "hostages" during a speech at the Labour Party conference on Tuesday. It happened as Starmer called for restraint and de-escalation on the border between Lebanon and Israel.
title: British prime minister accidentally says 'sausages' instead of 'hostages' during conference speech

description: South Korea has had to repeatedly shut down airport runways due to disruption from trash-carrying balloons sent by North Korea, a South Korean lawmaker said.
title: Trash balloons sent by North Korea cause regular disruptions at Seoul’s airports

description: WASHINGTON — Protesters in some U.S. cities demonstrated on Tuesday against American military support for Israel as risks have risen of a full-fledged conflict in the Middle East, with anti-war activists demanding an arms embargo against the U.S. ally.
title: Activists protest U.S. support for Israel as risks rise of wider Middle East war

description: China’s Ministry of Commerce said Tuesday it was launching a probe into Calvin Klein-parent PVH Group over alleged business disruptions around its Xinjiang supply chain.
title: China launches probe into Calvin Klein parent over Xinjiang supply chain ‘disruptions’

description: A few visitors at the tourist hotspot Cancun were still on the beach on Tuesday, despite warnings that Helene was approaching Mexico's Caribbean coast.
title: Cancun's beaches empty as Helene heads toward Mexico

description: Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan sat down with NBC News' Keir Simmons about his views on the Israel-Gaza after addressing the U.N. General Assembly.
title: Turkish President Erdogan: 'I don't approach Hamas as a terrorist organization'
